dt: {bc}to indicate or name by units or groups so as to find the total number of units involved {bc}{sx|number||}

dt.t: {wi}Count{/wi} the pages of the manuscript.

dt: {bc}to name the numbers in order up to and including

dt.t: {wi}Count{/wi} ten.

dt: {bc}to include in a tallying and reckoning

dt.t: about 100 present, {wi}counting{/wi} children
{wi}Count{/wi} cadence.
{wi}Count{/wi} the eighth notes.
{wi}count{/wi} oneself lucky

dt: {bc}to record as of an opinion or persuasion

dt.t: {wi}Count{/wi} me as uncommitted.

dt: {bc}to include or exclude by or as if by {a_link|counting}

dt.t: {wi}Count{/wi} me in.

dt: {bc}to recite or indicate the numbers in order by units or groups

dt.t: {wi}count{/wi} by fives

dt: {bc}to count the units in a group

dt.t: She was interrupted while she was {wi}counting{/wi}.

dt: {bc}to rely or depend on someone or something

dt.t: He {wi}counted{/wi} on his parents to help with the expenses.
It {wi}counts{/wi} up to a sizable amount.
These are the people who really {wi}count{/wi}.
His opinions don't {wi}count{/wi} for much.

dt: {bc}to deserve to be regarded or considered

dt.t: a job so easy it hardly {wi}counts{/wi} as work
in business for 50 years {it}and counting{/it}
{it}counted on{/it} winning

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}cunter, counter{/it}, from Latin {it}computare{/it}, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}putare{/it} to consider
shortdef: to indicate or name by units or groups so as to find the total number of units involved : number
to name the numbers in order up to and including
to include in a tallying and reckoning

dt: {bc}financial decision-making or analysis done by {d_link|bean counters|bean counter}

dt.t: We see ignorance in the bureaucratic {wi}bean counting{/wi} that threatens to overtake thoughtful, well-informed teaching.

shortdef: financial decision-making or analysis done by bean counters

dt: {bc}an audible backward {a_link|counting} in fixed units (such as seconds) from an arbitrary starting number to mark the time remaining before an event

shortdef: an audible backward counting in fixed units (such as seconds) from an arbitrary starting number to mark the time remaining before an event; also : preparations carried on during such a count

dt.t: If you are looking for people to help you clean the house today, {wi}count{/wi} me {wi}out{/wi}.

dt: {bc}to decide that (someone or something) cannot win or succeed

dt.t: Don't {wi}count out{/wi} our team just yet. They could still win.

dt: {bc}to count (a certain number of items to be separated from a quantity one is holding)

dt.t: He {wi}counted out{/wi} ten tickets and handed them to her.

dt: {bc}to signal the {d_link|knockout|knockout:1} of (a boxer who is down) by completing an audible count of 10 seconds before the boxer rises

shortdef: to not include (someone) in an activity
to decide that (someone or something) cannot win or succeed
to count (a certain number of items to be separated from a quantity one is holding)

dt: {bc}to count numbers that are spaced a certain number apart

dt.t: The students {it}counted off{/it} one by one.

shortdef: to count numbers that are spaced a certain number apart

dt.t: She {it}counted off{/it} all the things she wanted to do.
He {it}counted{/it} the reasons {it}off{/it} on his fingers.

dt: {bc}being careful not to eat too much

dt.t: No dessert for me—I'm {it}watching/counting my calories{/it}.

shortdef: being careful not to eat too much

dt: used to say that one does not care about how large a number is

dt.t: Tomorrow's my 84th birthday, but {it}who's counting{/it}?

shortdef: —used to say that one does not care about how large a number is
